content:
Unrecognized realm in id: hl7.fhir.dk.core.  ImplementationGuide.id must be in the form "hl7.[family].[realm].id" where family is uv or us.
     [xslt] /Users/jvi/dk-core-r4/template/scripts/onGenerate.genProperties.xslt:44: Fatal Error! Processing terminated by xsl:message at line 44 in onGenerate.genProperties.xslt
     [xslt] Failed to process /Users/jvi/dk-core-r4/template/onGenerate-ig-updated.xml

-what's the problem here @Grahame Grieve ?
Why can't I have an id of hl7.fhir.dk.core?
for the danish affiliate

@Lloyd McKenzie this one comes from the template. The message is incoherent (family must be uv or us?), and what's wrong with dk? And anyway, the rules are way more complicated than that for hl7.terminology, hl7.fhir.pubpack, hl7.cda....
why would you check over the much more complicated checking the IG publisher already does?

Because Jira depends on files being named in a particular way and therefore Jira needs to know what realms exist. This only comes into play if you're using the HL7 template - meaning the IG is being published by HL7 international as an HL7 international IG. The presumption was that only US and UV realm material would be published under the HL7 International template. Is that presumption incorrect?

if the policy is that the template is only for use nu us/uv, then the error message should say that the template is only for those realms, not that the realm is wrong (or that the 'family' should be uv or us).
@Jens Villadsen that implies that H7 DK should have it's own template like HL7 AU does - typically, it just modifies the header text and replaces the HL7 icon with the affiliate icon

One of the considerations here is whether a project is using HL7's balloting machinery. Right now, the use of Jira is tied to the use of the HL7 profile. However, if we're moving to affiliate balloting, we'll have to inject an intermediary level that does the Jira stuff, while not bringing the HL7 International logo into play.
or the Jira machinery is in the base and you turn it on in some of affiliate profiles
A whole lot of folks will use the base template who aren't HL7 I'd prefer to not put our complexity there, even if it's something we can turn off.
Is this Denmark IG going to use HL7 balloting?
No - not at this time
Can i request that someone makes a proper default template for affiliates only
We are roughly +20
clone the Hl7 Australia one

Jens Villadsen said:

Can i request that someone makes a proper default template for affiliates only

By request - I mean wish (@Giorgio Cangioli - maybe this could be a concrete task for TNT as most affiliates are in EU)
@Grahame Grieve https://github.com/hl7au/hl7.au.fhir.template or https://github.com/hl7au/hl7.au.base.template ?
or both?
both I think? @Lloyd McKenzie might be sure
Actually, I'd recommend driving off this one: https://github.com/HL7/ig-template-ca. It's simpler than the AU one. (Which for some reason overrides fhir.css, which isn't a great idea.)
My presumption was that each affiliate would create their own as they'd each have their own logos - and possibly have other customizations
@Lloyd McKenzie I think you are rigth in your presumption
I would recommend that a ig-template repo is setup for eg. affiliate of Zamunda, as an example for all affiliates - ready to be cloned and broadly used

And basically the only thing that an affiliate has to do is to rename the template id and substitute the logo. That will get the affiliate quickly up and running and leave time afterwards to do some digging into the details
At the moment, the Canadian one serves that purpose. It changes the logo, colors and nothing else
In that case I suggest that a repo gets created named ig-template-affiliate under https://github.com/HL7 - any objections to that?
I agree. In terms of IG templates, I think IHE is among the simplest - it uses the simplified color mechanism
What would an IG affiliate have?

Suggestions / questions:

  • Fixed colors?
  • We can have a logo that is simply called affiliate-logo.png, which allows editors to change their logo without custom template extensions
  • Are there any constraints or dependencies that apply only to affiliates?

BTW, the challenge of having an affiliate template was already reised, but was lost in the ether (and there was no demand then).
Check the second diagram here: https://github.com/costateixeira/ig_templates
like that @Jose Costa Teixeira , yes
So @Lloyd McKenzie you're suggesting that I stay away from hl7.fhir.template and instead use the fhir.base.template as CA does. Is that correctly understood?
Correct. hl7.fhir.template is for HL7-international published FHIR IGs. It inherits both the HL7 Int'l logo and a whole bunch of Jira stuff that affiliates probably don't want/shouldn't use.
Jens Villadsen has marked this topic as resolved.

Please don't rename the Canadian template. We like it here. :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:

However, having a base affiliate template does sound like a reasonable request. As for the "whole bunch of Jira stuff," what happens if/when affiliates adopt Jira balloting?
I'll ask @Joshua Procious to create the repo
@Elliot Silver when that happen then lets discuss it
I ended up using the fictional state of Illyria (chosen by Shakespeare) -> https://github.com/HL7/ig-template-affiliate - (@Jose Costa Teixeira FYI)
i forgot i had some commit pending. sorry
i will check this and see if I have anything to add
At a first glance, I had one difference:

instead of calling the css (and the logo) hl7.ly, i simply called it affiliate
so I have an affiliate.css, and an affiliate.png
feel free to commit the difference
this way, an affiliate that doesn't even want to make a custom css can simply add a logo

what should be the package id?
hl7.fhir.affiliate.template ?
or
hl7.affiliate.fhir.template ?
i think @Grahame Grieve can advise on this question
hl7.fhir.affiliate.template
that is most in line with CA and AU
yes
thanks
can i commit to main?
(if not..oops)
Next we can make a github template that every affiliate can use

like this one
https://github.com/openhie/empty-fhir-ig-custom
@Grahame Grieve , Lloyd just merged a pull request into the fhir.ca.template. What needs to be done to make it available?
@Elliot Silver I have to publish it. What's the github repo ID? And I need to have commit access to it (I will only use that for versioning new releases)
@Grahame Grieve https://github.com/HL7/ig-template-ca. I suspect you have access.
I do in that repo yes
ok done.
should just automatically work now

To close the related issue too - I created an affiliate empty IG that people can use as a boilerplate
https://github.com/hl7-be/affiliate-empty-ig
i started transferring ownership of this to HL7 - can someone pleas accept or take it over?
@Jens Villadsen this should wrap up the "affiliate template" thing for now.
:+1:
@Jose Costa Teixeira then we 'just' need the publication part
On it... I have some challenges with GitHub actions
what's the publication part?
release publication. There were some issues but I can't find any now.
well, I publish the templates directly. Including the affiliate ones. Though not the BE one.
I mean the publication script that @Jose Costa Teixeira made
So, for the publication issues (and I'm just abusing this thread), the issue now is that I am running this entire thing as a python process. It works on my machine, but not on github actions.

the problem is:

  1. I run the publisher normally in a github action
  2. then I start the python script which calls the publisher (a few times)
step 1 goes ok. But step 2 complains that it has no suhsi, nor jekyll installed
Nevermind. The template is working and there is a empty IG to use as template.

Question:
If someone publishes a package x.y.z with Simplifier, and then publish an IG with the same package ID but new content (or vice-versa) what happens? Is there a conflict?
is there a conflict where?
when an IG would dependOn the package, how would it work?
how would what work? what versions would they have?
assuming they'd have different versions

x.y.z v1 - Simplifier
x.y.z v2 - IG
(or vice-versa)
We are using combinations of these tools and I've been asked how these scenarios work

Meanwhile, @Jens Villadsen I have 3 words for you
Ho! Ho! Ho!
as far I know, it doesn't matter to any tools I write
once they are published. The current version thing doesn't work with unpublished content on simplifier, but other than that, everything hangs off registry.fhir.org - which is simplifier
(now I just need to learn how to get a package onto registry.fhir.org)
publish a feed and register it
the IG publisher automatically builds the feed for you when it does publish-process
sweet music to my ears

Grahame Grieve said:

publish a feed and register it

Now I just need to know how to publish a feed and register it :)
well, if you use the IG publisher, it automatically creates it. package-feed.xml (and publication-feed.xml for humans)
What do i do with those?
copy them up to the server like any other file
what server?
your web server
ok
Doesn't the release publication take care of that ?
take care of waht?
i mean: once I run the release publication and upload the entire thing to my webserver, then those files are there, right?
yes
then make a PR registering the feed here: https://github.com/FHIR/ig-registry/blob/master/package-feeds.json
right, that is what I was missing. thanks
(and I don't recall, but perhaps that is why the release publication uses the ig-registry, right?)
no the IG registry is a parallel system that maintains a searchable list of IGs. It would be possible to build most of the information in the IG registry from what is published, but not all of it
ok
